channel.title: Dealfun.com
channel.description:
Anyone ever heard of [url=http://Www.Dealfun.com]Www.Dealfun.com[/url]. Basically its a bidding website. Was looking through google for Refurb. Iphone's and came across Dealfun, it seems like a scam, but I can't really tell, lol. If anyone has any feedback on it i'd like to hear it =D
Thanks

item.title: Dealfun.com
item.dc:creator: @mcbeans mcbeans
item.description:
@mcbeans wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:7, topic:408971”][quote author=mcbeans link=topic=510254.msg3704227#msg3704227 date=1312935381]
cyber market vs real market
let’s see who wins.
[/quote]
Depends how well you can work the specific cyber market you are dealing with. I managed to get a $250 monitor for my desktop for a measly $30 + another $15 for shipping. Came still in its new box (surprisingly) and without any scratches.[/quote]
well what i meant was free trade market, as in ebay and such?

Read full topic

@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“mcbeans, post:6, topic:408971”]cyber market vs real market
let’s see who wins.[/quote]
Depends how well you can work the specific cyber market you are dealing with. I managed to get a $250 monitor for my desktop for a measly $30 + another $15 for shipping. Came still in its new box (surprisingly) and without any scratches.

item.title: Dealfun.com
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

You have to be careful with your bids though. They add up in price in addition to what you pay for the final price.

item.description:

You get what you pay for

item.title: Dealfun.com
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

TheCyberMan:

Looks like something like Quibids. You really pay more money than it seems…

Probably so, Im just looking for an AT&T Iphone 4 for around $200, cause im not paying $4-600 for one without a contract upgrade

Everyone on Ebay/Craigslist are $350+. All i’m looking for is somewhere I can get one for cheaper.

Read full topic
